intro: Sphalmanthus herrei, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, using its tendrils to ascend supports. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sphalmanthus herrei is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun.
